definitions.definition: the fact of giving up something important or valuable to you in order to get or do something that seems more important; something that you give up in this way

examples.text: The makers of the product assured us that there had been no sacrifice of quality.
Her parents **made sacrifices** so that she could have a good education.
to make the **ultimate/supreme sacrifice** *(= to die for your country, to save a friend, etc.)*

definitions.definition: the act of offering something to a god, especially an animal that has been killed in a special way; an animal, etc. that is offered in this way

examples.text: They offered sacrifices to the gods.
a human sacrifice *(= a person killed as a )*

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin sacrificium; related to sacrificus ‘sacrificial’, from sacer ‘holy’.
